Accountability and financial transparency are the foundation of a well-managed and open government. The Palestine City Council and the City of Palestine staff make government transparency a top priority.

### City Charter and Ordinances

The City Charter, created by the citizens of Palestine for its municipal government, is the first chapter in the
[City of Palestine Code of Ordinances](https://library.municode.com/tx/palestine/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTICH)
.

### Mayor

The Mayor of Palestine is elected every two years and is the president of the city council. The current Mayor of Palestine is Mitchell Jordan.

* [Email Mayor Jordan](mailto:Mayor@palestine-tx.org)

### City Council

The Palestine City Council serves the residents of Palestine through six representative districts. Each elected council member serves for a two-year term. More information, including contact information for council members, can be found on the
[City Council page](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/323/City-Council)
.

The City Secretary records and maintains agendas and minutes from City Council meetings. An indexed list of agendas and minutes can be found at the city's
Meetings Portal
.

* [Request to Address the City Council (PDF)](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/DocumentCenter/View/3827)

All the city departments can be accessed from the
Departments section
. Each Department page contains contact information for Department personnel.

Employee contact information can be found in the
Staff Directory
.

The City of Palestine Health Services has transitioned to the Bureau Veritas.
is now the local jurisdiction responsible for Environmental Health Services which includes retail food inspections, commercial pool/spa/PIWF, and adult and child care facilities for the City of Palestine. All applications, fees, and administration paperwork must be submitted directly to
, located at 100 E 15th St., Suite 100 Fort Worth, TX 76102.
To find information on food and pool inspections, visit
https://www.bvna.com/
.

Financial data and online resources provide information on how city tax dollars are budgeted, spent, and invested. We endeavor to make both the information and the way it is presented as clear and informative as possible.

The City of Palestine's Finance Department publishes financial information for public inspection, including:

* Financial Reports to City Council

* + A tax rate of $0.614285 per $100 valuation is the property tax rate for the City of Palestine. Revenue from property taxes funds the general fund, operating expenses, and debt service.
  + For more information on City of Palestine property taxes, click on the
    Finance Department's page
    . For more information about property taxes in Anderson County, visit the
    Anderson County Tax Assessor Collector's page
    , or the
    [Anderson County Appraisal District's page](http://www.andersoncad.net/)
    . Also, the Texas Comptroller has information on its
    Truth in Taxation page
    .
* + The Sales Tax Rate of 8.25% is made up of 6.25% State of Texas, 0.50% Anderson County and 1.50% City of Palestine. The 1.50% is made up of 1.125% to General Fund, 0.125% to Dedicated Street Repair and Maintenance, and 0.250% to Economic Development.
* + The Sales Tax Rate of 13% is made up of 6% State of Texas and 7% City of Palestine.
  + Information on Hotel Occupancy Sales Tax as of Fiscal Year-end can be found at these links:
    - [September 30, 2023 (PDF)](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/DocumentCenter/View/2451)
    - [September 30, 2022 (PDF)](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/DocumentCenter/View/2829)
    - [September 30, 2018 (PDF)](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/DocumentCenter/View/472)
    - [September 30, 2017 (PDF)](https://www.cityofpalestinetx.com/DocumentCenter/View/473)

Information on purchasing requirements and projects can be found on the City's purchasing page.

Information on unclaimed property in the City of Palestine can be found on the state of Texas' website,
Texas Unclaimed Property
.
